Had "happy hour" tapas. All dishes were exceptional. Mussels in a chorizo broth and lemony calamari were standouts. Also great was arugula and quinoa salad. Who'da thought that I'd actually crave more of that delicious salad combo? Never a bad meal at this place.

My son and I are continually searching for the best burger in town. We just came up here and as I just had my plate swept away, I find myself leaving this review. Hands down, the BEST burger I have ever had. Holy smoke! My son have it some thought, then rendered the same opinion. Get up here and try it!

I went out with my family to celebrate my birthday. I picked Cafe Bink because we think we're kind of "foodies" and I'd heard Binkley's was amazing but a little too expensive. So, I thought we'd try Cafe Bink instead....   We went on a Sunday night at 7:30 and there wasn't a wait. We picked our table on the patio and the weather and music outside was perfect. Although it is a little close to the street it was still really nice.   I didn't catch our server's name but he was FANTASTIC. You can tell he truly enjoys what he does. Very friendly and fun!   There were four of us. For appetizers we ordered the baby order of fries (of course, based on everyone's reviews), the mozzarella, and the country pate.  My dad really wanted the pate.  The three of us tried it - not bad.  Wouldn't order it again but my dad really liked it.  Was expecting the mozzarella to be great but it was just okay.  Maybe we're too used to the standard flavor/texture of the typical mozzarella served in most caprese salads.  This was pretty flavorless and kind of a chewy texture.  I prefer the stuff I'm used to, I guess.  But, the french fries were amazing.  My dad wouldn't stop talking about them.  And the truffle ketchup was good too.  But, I might have preferred regular ketchup, too.  The other sauces were just okay.    We (me, my brother and his wife) were already getting full so skipped the salads but my dad wanted one.  So, we sat and enjoyed being on the patio while he enjoyed his caesar salad.  He said it was great (not to heavy on the anchovy) and ate every last bite.  On to the entrees - my brother got the bolognese/polenta and said it was really good (but heavy).  He didn't finish it all but took it home.  My sister-in-law and I split the chicken picatta.  It was WONDERFUL.  The chicken was juicy and flavorful and the pasta (homemade) was great.  I could have eaten a huge bowl of just the pasta.  Plus, the perfect size - we each got a big piece of chicken.  Then, my dad got the ribs.  He said they were great, too and ate every last bite.  For dessert my brother wanted the donuts (AMAZING - especially with the cream dipping sauce), I ordered the chocolate souffle (AMAZING) and the three little ice cream sandwiches (one vanilla/chocolate chip cookie, one mint/chocolate cookie and one honey/gingersnap cookie).  They were good too but definitely the donuts and the souffle are the way to go.    My next time there I'm definitely getting a glass of wine, the chicken picatta for myself and the chocolate souffle and I'd be a very happy girl!    Would highly recommend it......

The food was okay...very salty, but the reason for the rating was the service. Do come here for sunday brunch unlesd you have three hours to wait and are not that hungry. The manager gave us a discount and free dessert to comp us for our time.

The bartender saved this place from a 0 or 1 start review.  I took my foodie son for happy hour on a Saturday while we were up north because he has rally wanted to check it out. There were NO other customers when we arrived so I would expect decent quality- even if we ordered from the happy hour menu. How hard is it to get french fries and a burger right?  French Fries: absurdly oversalted. The aiolis and truffle ketchup were tasty and, thank goodness, almost covered up the sodium saturated fries they were served with.  Housemade Potato Chips- So much potential, so much f$#*ing salt. Aggressively oversalted.  Burger- I ordered a burger with Swiss cheese and was petrified my the smell. It smelled rotten. Tasted like cheese that was (way) past it's prime. The kitchen said it was a fancy french gruyere and supposed to taste that way. Cough (bullshit) cough. The bartender took it away and brought me another one without cheese. It was raw and mushy inside. I finally gave up on trying to get anything to eat. Corndog- palatable  Slopp Joe- tasty, overly sweet, served lukewarm Wine was delicious. My son had a tasty chocolate mousse for his birthday that was very well-executed. Super friendly bartender (Christopher) compensated for the poor food. Extremely unimpressed with the food. Wondering what the fuss is about.  Won't try this again.  Suggest you don't bother (unless you need a glass of wine and mousse).

I love a restaurant that has unique choices and caters to the customers palate. I had a delightful meal of saut√©ed brussel sprouts with bacon, french onion soup and profiteroles. This is a nicely appointed small restaurant with outdoor seating, first class wines, designer beers and multiple alcohol choices. The service is first class with knowledgeable, professional, personable staff that strives to make your experience memorable. The flavors are fresh and delightful. Thank you for the experience! I will be back to try the rest of the menu.

Just as no one wants a one-star experience...no one wants to write a one-star review.  The odd thing is: in this case, I do want to go back. Next time - just my husband and I - and I want to focus on what the heck is going on. Next time - I will speak to a manager if things go south.  We were a party of four one December evening. We were seated inside but near the front door and it was terribly drafty for all of us, but especially the two of us in chairs. It was definitely NOT the best seat in the house. The patio is beautiful in good weather and is where we will aim to sit next time.   Next time, I will specifically request a seasoned server. We can only assume that our server was inexperienced as he was rather slow (speed-wise) and generally speaking when it came to the complaints about our food. (Actually, we didn't complain, but a good server knows when guests are not happy. He never specifically asked, "how is everything" either.) We simply didn't enjoy the taste of anything of three different entrees. Each of us was requesting a different "poison" - salt, cilantro, ranch or ketchup.  The meals had by the husbands were both bland. I tasted the Buttermilk Fried Chicken and can vouch for its mediocrity. It was more mushy than anything and simply flavorless. My husband tells me that our server actually referred to himself as "a buffer" between diners & the kitchen. I think that's the strangest thing I've ever heard. A server is a liaison - letting the chef know how meals are being received. I myself was pretty wrapped up in conversation, enjoying our friends so didn't pay as much attention as usual to the server. This is why I say: next time!  We girls shared the "all you can eat" special roasted pork. (Note: for $29 EACH ~ there was nothing "sharing" about it...I think we really should have left with half a pig, but rather a clump of meat was delivered in a small community bowl...is why the word "sharing" came to mind.  Anyway ~ tasty, this was not.)  There was something "twangy" about that pork. I still can't identify the taste. Maybe it was something in the flavor of the wood used to smoke it.   In any event, the whole Bink experience was best summed up by my girlfriend to the guys when I'd stepped away for a moment later in the evening at the bar where we'd ended up: "What did you guys think of the dinner?" My husband had thought that she'd suggested the restaurant and he cushioned his response, "It wasn't all that." She could tell he was holding back & she replied emphatically, "We thought it was terrible."   What was truly terrible to me was the length of time our meal took (2.5 hrs for wine, dinner, dessert and coffee) and then getting the "bum's rush" come 9:50 pm on a Saturday night. I noticed just a couple other tables left in the place and finding out "we close at 10" from our server. It's courtesy to let people linger when they've just dropped more than a couple hundred on dinner & drinks AND are still there because of slow-ass service. Not cool.  The only redeeming factor was the wine list & consistency of pours.   So...four out of four of us, without conferring on it all came to one conclusion: "terrible."    I'm going to call this conclusion a "working hypothesis" and I will test it one last time because I've not only genuinely come to value the opinion of fellow yelpers, but also because our experience was so perfectly terrible that it was comedic. I must see what happens next!

I was there on a weekend for lunch. The place was not crowded and the service was excellent. I tried couple of appetizers including their fried okra. They were delicious. The salads were good but I think I had higher expectation, hence minus one star.

Food is consistently good, but on the most recent evening out, we found the server too pushy.  The heirloom salad had a delicious dressing on it, but the tomatoes were cold, right out of the fridge, and tasteless. So 3 stars for the  Rainbow Trout, and no stars for the pushy server.

Great spot. Terrific menu!   Everything that we have eaten there has been exceptional! Delicate sauces. Complex and interesting layers of flavor. Unique ingredients.  Love the layout of the space too. Seeing the action in the kitchen is fun.  We loved it.

Our favorite, go to, restaurant. Whether we are starving or entertaining visitors or having the best cocktails during the happy hour...must have: French fries with 3 sauces, ribs, fabulous salads and daily specials.  The wait staff are attentive and friendly, crazy winter crowds or summer slow season, they take special care of each customer.

I honestly don't get how this charming place isn't at least four (4) stars.  The food is yummy. Not overly incentive, but that's good!!  For my neighbor haunt, I want straight forward recognizable food.  Solid. Flavorful.  GOOD.    There's a solid wine list and the service is good.    In short, a great place

I have to say, this place is quite a gem.  It is good enough for me to make the haul from Phoenix to the northland for lunch on the weekends.  I had the "sloppy joes" but it was not like anything my mom ever made (in a good way).  The fries are outstanding.  I had lunch with 8 other people, and they were all equally as pleased.  Service was great. Wine was excellent.  The setting was laid-back and comfortable.  I am really looking forward to going back.

We were pleased to have a late lunch here after a long drive from Gallup, New Mexico.  It is very close to our house in Scottsdale.   We had a nice corner booth next to the chefs area so we could witness all excellent preparation.     I had a cup of Gazpacho which was very tasty!  My Brunch ,or dinner was the Salmon, bacon lettuce  and tomato  sandwich.  The bread chosen was delicious in and of itself.  This was a great dinner for me.  I would order it again.   My wife started with a large helping of Fried Okra.  She loves Okra; and, she said it was super!.  For her dinner she had the chopped salad, which had everything in it.   I had a Pinot Grigio from New Zealand .  I was surprised how smooth it was.  My wife had the Raeburn Chardonnay . It is always good.   For dessert I had ice cream. Our server was Matt.  He was very attentive to all our many needs, ie glass of ice only,  two ice waters, etc. Matt was assisted from time to time by Debra who was most professional!!   CHEF BINKLEY is widely known in our area for providing the best experience , most updated menu; and always with fresh, in season ingredients.  Sincerely,  Ed Altman Jr
